timeline.message: automated server stub generation through gradle
enhanced sanity script to validate grpc inference api
fixed path issue in grpc client
fixed incorrect exit logic in client script
removed json parse in python gRPC client
added regression test cases for gRPC regression APIs
enhanced error handling for inference APIs
added support for datafile driven management api test collection
added gRPC support for management APIs
added minor fixes found during testing
enhanced grpc pytest suite to use grpc client for registering and unregistering model
updated command to generate python client stubs
removed netty http staus dependency from wlm framework
refacroted common code to utility module
added gRPC management api test cases in regression suite and minor fixes
added ssl support for gRPC server
added reference to python gRPC client, used in regression suite, in grpc doc
added validation for register and unregister model in sanity script
updated gRPC server await termination code
added null check before terminating gRPC servers
skipped grpc package from jacoco verification
added error logs in gRPC client
added gRPC server interceptor to log api access data
refactored test cases to removed code duplication

Fixed typo in link.

Co-authored-by: Amit Agarwal <amtagrwl@gmail.com>
fixed compilation issues after conflict resolution

timeline.bodyText: it is better to be configurable: REST/gRPC/both
timeline.author: lxning

replies.bodyText: @lxning: Logged following enhancement ticket to track this: #799. This is not a blocker item for the 0.3.0 release.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.message: fixed path in grpc client stub generation

timeline.author: maaquib

timeline.bodyText: Can we refactor these messages to a util class to be re-used by REST and gRPC, so that we don't have to make changes in two place?
timeline.author: maaquib

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be getScheduled? Why are we changing how inferTime is measured?
timeline.author: maaquib

replies.bodyText: This was changed as part of #666. At the time of job queue both begin and scheduled hold the same value. Also, the scheduled parameter provides a setter that will overwrite the value with System.nanoTime(); whenever called.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: Whats the reason for this remapping? Seems like 413 is appropriate
timeline.author: maaquib

replies.bodyText: This was because we refactored all the error codes sent from the WLM package to use HTTP Status code  Java's inbuilt HTTPURLConnection instead of Netty's HTTPResponseStatus. And HTTPURLConnection doesn't have the 507 code available. Hence, we used the 413 code instead and re-mapped it to 507 to keep the error codes backward compatible.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.author: maaquib
maaquib

timeline.bodyText: This and following util methods should be refactored to the base class so that they can be used in the InferenceImpl.java too
timeline.author: maaquib

replies.bodyText:
@maaquib: Both Inference APIs and Management APIs use different responseObserver types. Also, the inference API has only one main API (predict). Thus for avoiding one minor code duplication we will need to add a bunch of complicated type castings.
I have refactored the InferenceImpl.java to avoid code duplication within the file for sending error response.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: Same as above, can you explain whats the reason for change 507 to 513?
timeline.author: maaquib

timeline.message: Merge branch 'issue_656' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into issue_656
